title: Luminary Tour: Van Gogh and the Avant Garde
hero_caption: Vincent van Gogh. The Poet’s Garden (detail), 1888. The Art Institute of Chicago, Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Larned Coburn Memorial Collection.
short_description:
Luminary are invited to connect with Jacquelyn N. Coutré, Eleanor Wood Prince Associate Curator, Painting and Sculpture of Europe, and Jena Carvana, curatorial associate, as they explore the exhibition Van Gogh and the Avant-Garde: The Modern Landscape.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to 18 participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes.
list_description: On this guided small-group tour, join fellow Luminary to explore The Language of Beauty in African Art with Constantine Petridis, chair and curator of Arts of Africa.
description:

Contact Us

Interested in joining Luminary? Please reach out to us at luminary@artic.edu or (312) 443-3735 to begin enjoying the benefits of membership in this dedicated community of art enthusiasts, including exclusive opportunities with artists and curators, behind-the-scene tours, VIP tickets, and invitations to travel.
